starmap

Class StarCube

  • java.lang.Object
    • starmap.StarCube

  • public class StarCube
extends Object
    Geometric operations for 3d projections of stars.
    Author:
    Antti Rautiainen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StarCube(Vector3f center, float radians)
      this creates a cube with center in center, front edges of which are equally far from the zero, and width radians (right ascensions) in the declination level the of center.
      StarCube(Vector3f center, Vector3f observationSpot, Matrix3f transformation) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector3f getCenter() 
      Vector3f getCenterSpherical() 
      float getEdgelength() 
      Vector3f getObservationSpot() 
      Vector3f getObservationSpotSpherical() 
      void moveCenterAngle(float theta, float phi)
      turns center to angles theta and phi, given in radians.
      void moveCenterDistance(float r)
      Moves center to a new distance r.
      void setCenter(Vector3f center)
      Sets center coordinates.
      void setCenterSpherical(float r, float theta, float phi)
      Sets center coordinates, if given in spherical coordinates.
      void setEdgelength(float edgelength)
      Setting length of the edge of the cube scales transformation matrix and moves observation spot, but not center.
      void setObservationSpot(Vector3f observationSpot)
      Sets observation spot.
      void setObservationSpotSpherical(float r, float theta, float phi)
      Sets observation spot from spherical coordinates.
      Vector3f transform(double x, double y, double z)
      This transforms absolute coordinates to relative coordinates of the cube.

        public StarCube(Vector3f center,
        Vector3f observationSpot,

      • StarCube

        public StarCube(Vector3f center,
        float radians)
        this creates a cube with center in center, front edges of which are equally far from the zero, and width radians (right ascensions) in the declination level the of center.

    • Method Detail

      • getCenter

        public Vector3f getCenter()

      • setCenter

        public void setCenter(Vector3f center)
        Sets center coordinates. observationSpot always moves along the center. It is supposed that center always moves when set is called.
        Parameters:
        center -

      • getCenterSpherical

        public Vector3f getCenterSpherical()

      • setCenterSpherical

        public void setCenterSpherical(float r,
                      float theta,
                      float phi)
        Sets center coordinates, if given in spherical coordinates.
        Parameters:
        r - new distance
        theta - new angle
        phi - new angle

      • moveCenterDistance

        public void moveCenterDistance(float r)
        Moves center to a new distance r. observationSpot the same direction and distance.
        Parameters:
        r - new distance

      • moveCenterAngle

        public void moveCenterAngle(float theta,
                   float phi)
        turns center to angles theta and phi, given in radians. When observationSpot is in zero, it does not move, but the transformation matrix turns. Otherwise it moves together with the center and transformation matrix does not turn.
        Parameters:
        theta - new angle
        phi - new angle

      • getObservationSpot

        public Vector3f getObservationSpot()

      • setObservationSpot

        public void setObservationSpot(Vector3f observationSpot)
        Sets observation spot. center always moves along the observationSpot

      • getObservationSpotSpherical

        public Vector3f getObservationSpotSpherical()

      • setObservationSpotSpherical

        public void setObservationSpotSpherical(float r,
                               float theta,
                               float phi)
        Sets observation spot from spherical coordinates. center always moves along the observationSpot

      • getEdgelength

        public float getEdgelength()

      • setEdgelength

        public void setEdgelength(float edgelength)
        Setting length of the edge of the cube scales transformation matrix and moves observation spot, but not center.
        Parameters:
        edgelength - length of of an edge of the starcube

      • transform

        public Vector3f transform(double x,
                 double y,
                 double z)
        This transforms absolute coordinates to relative coordinates of the cube.
        Parameters:
        x - component of a vector
        y - component of a vector
        z - component of a vector
        Returns:
        a vector with relative coordinates
